title: Psalms Chapter 94 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Psalms chapter 94 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Psalms Chapter 94 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Psalms Chapter 94.

questions.question: To whom does vengeance belong according to Psalms 94:1?
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD God
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:1 states that vengeance belongs to the LORD God.

questions.question: What does Psalms 94:2 ask God to do as judge of the earth?
options: Render a reward to the proud
questions.correctAnswer: Render a reward to the proud
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:2 calls on God to render a reward to the proud as judge of the earth.

questions.question: According to Psalms 94:3, what question is asked about the wicked?
options: How long shall the wicked triumph?
questions.correctAnswer: How long shall the wicked triumph?
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:3 asks how long the wicked shall triumph.

questions.question: Who do the wicked break in pieces as mentioned in Psalms 94:5?
questions.correctAnswer: God's people
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:5 says the wicked break in pieces God's people.

questions.question: In Psalms 94:6, which groups are said to be slain by the wicked?
questions.correctAnswer: The widow and the stranger
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:6 states that the wicked slay the widow and the stranger.

questions.question: What do the wicked claim about the LORD in Psalms 94:7?
options: The LORD shall not see nor regard it
The LORD is mighty to save
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD shall not see nor regard it
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:7 records the wicked saying the LORD shall not see nor regard their actions.

questions.question: According to Psalms 94:9, what did God plant?
questions.correctAnswer: The ear
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:9 says God planted the ear and formed the eye.

questions.question: What does Psalms 94:10 say God does to the heathen?
questions.correctAnswer: Chastiseth and corrects them
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:10 states that God chastiseth the heathen and corrects them.

questions.question: According to Psalms 94:11, what does the LORD know about the thoughts of man?
questions.correctAnswer: That they are vanity
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:11 says the LORD knows the thoughts of man are vanity.

questions.question: Who is blessed according to Psalms 94:12?
options: The man whom the LORD chastens and teaches
questions.correctAnswer: The man whom the LORD chastens and teaches
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:12 teaches that the man whom the LORD chastens and teaches is blessed.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 94:14 says the LORD will forsake his inheritance.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:14 states the LORD will not forsake his inheritance.

questions.question: True or False: According to Psalms 94:16, someone stands up against evildoers for the psalmist.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:16 asks who will rise up against evildoers, showing no one has yet.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 94:22 describes the LORD as a rock of refuge.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:22 calls the LORD the rock of the psalmist's refuge.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Psalms 94:18: 'When I said, My foot ______; thy mercy, O LORD, held me up.'
questions.correctAnswer: slippeth
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:18 uses the word 'slippeth' in the phrase about the foot slipping and God's mercy holding up.

questions.question: According to Psalms 94:23, what will the LORD do to the wicked?
options: Bring upon them their own iniquity and cut them off
questions.correctAnswer: Bring upon them their own iniquity and cut them off
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:23 declares the LORD will bring the wicked’s own iniquity upon them and cut them off.

medium.title: Psalms Chapter 94 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Psalms Chapter 94 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with trusting God's justice when the wicked seem to prosper. Based on Psalms 94, what biblical truth would you share?
options: God is the judge of the earth and will render a reward to the proud.
The wicked will always continue to triumph without consequence.
God does not see or care about the actions of the wicked.
We should take vengeance into our own hands.
questions.correctAnswer: God is the judge of the earth and will render a reward to the proud.
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:2 reminds us that God is the judge of the earth who will reward the proud. Verses 1, 14, and 15 also affirm God's justice and his refusal to forsake his people, encouraging trust in His righteous judgment.

questions.question: How does Psalms 94 teach us about humility and gaining wisdom?
options: By calling the brutish and fools to understand and be wise.
By boasting in our own knowledge and strength.
By ignoring God's correction and continuing in sin.
By seeking revenge on those who do wrong to us.
questions.correctAnswer: By calling the brutish and fools to understand and be wise.
questions.explanation: In Psalms 94:8, the psalmist calls those lacking wisdom to understand and become wise. This emphasizes humility and openness to God's teaching. Verses 10 and 12 also highlight God’s correction and teaching as blessings for the humble.

questions.question: What encouragement does Psalms 94 offer to someone facing adversity and feeling overwhelmed?
options: God’s mercy will hold you up when your foot slips.
You are alone in your struggle and must rely on yourself.
God will never help you in difficult times.
You should ignore your troubles and pretend all is well.
questions.correctAnswer: God’s mercy will hold you up when your foot slips.
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:18 expresses that when the psalmist felt like slipping, God's mercy held him up. Verses 17 and 19 also affirm God's help and comforting presence in times of distress.

questions.question: According to Psalms 94, how should Christians respond to the wicked who oppress others?
options: Trust God to bring their iniquity upon them and not take vengeance ourselves.
Join them in oppressing others to gain power.
Ignore their wrongdoing and accept it as normal.
Seek personal revenge to right the wrongs.
questions.correctAnswer: Trust God to bring their iniquity upon them and not take vengeance ourselves.
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:23 says the LORD will bring upon the wicked their own iniquity and cut them off. Verses 1-3 encourage God to show Himself in vengeance, meaning we should trust God's justice rather than acting in personal vengeance.

questions.question: A believer feels discouraged because the wicked speak hard things and boast. What does Psalms 94 teach about this behavior?
options: The wicked’s boasting is temporary and God sees their deeds.
Their boasting is proof they will never be judged.
We should imitate their boldness to gain respect.
God approves of their speech and actions.
questions.correctAnswer: The wicked’s boasting is temporary and God sees their deeds.
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:4-7 reveals that though the wicked boast and speak harshly, God sees their actions and will not ignore them. This encourages believers to trust God's oversight and judgment.

questions.question: How does Psalms 94 illustrate God’s knowledge about human thoughts and actions?
options: The LORD knows that the thoughts of man are vanity.
God is unaware of human thoughts and only judges actions.
Human thoughts are always righteous before God.
God only judges external behavior, not inner thoughts.
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD knows that the thoughts of man are vanity.
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:11 states that the LORD knows the thoughts of man and that they are vanity. This shows God's complete knowledge of our inner lives, urging believers toward sincerity and humility.

questions.question: What assurance does Psalms 94 give about God's relationship with His people during trials?
options: The LORD will not cast off His people nor forsake His inheritance.
God abandons His people when they suffer.
People must endure trials without God's help.
Trials prove that God is displeased and distant.
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD will not cast off His people nor forsake His inheritance.
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:14 assures believers that God remains faithful to His people even in adversity. This encourages perseverance and trust in God's steadfast care.

questions.question: What does Psalms 94 teach about the benefit of God's chastening and instruction?
options: Blessed is the man whom God chastens and teaches out of His law.
Chastening is a punishment without purpose.
God’s instruction is unnecessary for the righteous.
Chastening is only for the wicked and should be feared.
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed is the man whom God chastens and teaches out of His law.
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:12 explains that those who receive God's discipline and teaching are blessed, as it leads to wisdom and rest from adversity, encouraging obedience and growth.

questions.question: True or False: According to Psalms 94, God will ignore the violence committed against widows, strangers, and the fatherless.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:6-7 shows that even when the wicked slay widows, strangers, and fatherless, God sees and regards these acts, refuting the claim that He ignores such injustice.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 94 teaches that the throne of iniquity can have fellowship with God.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:20 asks rhetorically if the throne of iniquity can have fellowship with God, implying it cannot. This teaches that evil and God’s holiness are incompatible.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "Blessed is the man whom thou ________, O LORD, and teachest him out of thy law."
questions.correctAnswer: chastenest
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:12 says, "Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O LORD, and teachest him out of thy law," highlighting the blessing in God's discipline and teaching.

questions.question: How does Psalms 94 instruct us to view God's help in times of personal weakness?
options: God’s help sustains us when we feel like we will fall.
We must rely solely on our own strength without God.
Weakness is a sign that God has abandoned us.
Help comes only if we perform perfectly.
questions.correctAnswer: God’s help sustains us when we feel like we will fall.
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:17-18 shows the psalmist almost dwelling in silence but being held up by God's mercy, teaching believers to trust God’s sustaining help in weakness.

questions.question: What does Psalms 94 say about those who frame mischief by a law?
options: They are part of the throne of iniquity and cannot have fellowship with God.
They are righteous leaders who promote justice.
God approves their laws and actions.
They are blessed and will be rewarded immediately.
questions.correctAnswer: They are part of the throne of iniquity and cannot have fellowship with God.
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:20 indicates that those who frame mischief by law belong to the throne of iniquity, teaching that corrupt legal schemes are opposed to God’s righteousness.

questions.question: According to Psalms 94, who is described as the rock of refuge and defence for the righteous?
options: The LORD is my defence and my God is the rock of my refuge.
The king of the land is the refuge and defence.
My own strength is my refuge and defence.
The wicked provide refuge and defence for the righteous.
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is my defence and my God is the rock of my refuge.
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:22 affirms that God is the protector and refuge of the righteous, encouraging believers to trust Him as their stronghold.

questions.question: What question does Psalms 94 pose about standing against evildoers?
options: Who will rise up and stand up for me against evildoers?
Why should we ignore evildoers and their actions?
Should we join evildoers for personal gain?
Is it better to remain silent in the face of iniquity?
questions.correctAnswer: Who will rise up and stand up for me against evildoers?
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:16 asks who will defend the psalmist against evildoers, highlighting the need for God’s help and the responsibility to stand for righteousness.

hard.title: Psalms Chapter 94 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Psalms Chapter 94.

questions.question: In Psalms 94:1, to whom does vengeance belong according to the Psalmist?
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD God
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:1 explicitly states that vengeance belongs to the LORD God, highlighting His role as the righteous judge.

questions.question: Psalm 94:3 asks, 'LORD, how long shall the wicked triumph?' This question reflects which broader biblical theme?
options: Theodicy and the problem of evil
questions.correctAnswer: Theodicy and the problem of evil
questions.explanation: The question reveals the Psalmist’s grappling with the apparent success of the wicked, a central issue in biblical theodicy (Psalms 94:3).

questions.question: What literary device is predominantly used in Psalms 94:4, where the wicked 'utter and speak hard things' and 'boast themselves'?
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism
questions.explanation: This verse employs synonymous parallelism, a common Hebrew poetic device where two lines express similar ideas to reinforce meaning (Psalms 94:4).

questions.question: In Psalms 94:6, who are specifically mentioned as victims of the wicked's violence?
options: The widow, the stranger, and the fatherless
The elders, the youth, and the soldiers
The rich, the merchants, and the scribes
questions.correctAnswer: The widow, the stranger, and the fatherless
questions.explanation: The verse highlights the social vulnerability of these groups and the injustice inflicted on them (Psalms 94:6).

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 94:7 claims that the wicked believe the LORD neither sees nor regards their actions.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly states that the wicked say the LORD shall not see or regard their deeds (Psalms 94:7).

questions.question: The rhetorical questions in Psalms 94:9-10 emphasize God's attributes of:
questions.correctAnswer: Hearing, seeing, and correcting
questions.explanation: Verses 9-10 use rhetorical questions to affirm that God, who formed the ear and eye, will hear, see, and correct the nations (Psalms 94:9-10).

questions.question: According to Psalms 94:11, what does the LORD know about the thoughts of man?
questions.correctAnswer: That they are vanity
questions.explanation: The verse states plainly that the LORD understands the futility or vanity of human thoughts (Psalms 94:11).

questions.question: In Psalms 94:12, what two things does the LORD do to bless a man?
options: Chasten him and teach him out of His law
Provide him wealth and long life
Protect him from enemies and give him peace
Anoint him as king and make him wise
questions.correctAnswer: Chasten him and teach him out of His law
questions.explanation: The verse praises those whom the LORD disciplines and instructs according to His law, leading to true blessing (Psalms 94:12).

questions.question: Which Old Testament theme is reflected in Psalms 94:14, where the LORD will not cast off His people?
questions.correctAnswer: Covenant faithfulness
questions.explanation: The assurance that God will not forsake His inheritance echoes the covenant promises to Israel (Psalms 94:14).

questions.question: How does Psalms 94:15 connect the concept of judgment to righteousness?
options: Judgment shall return to righteousness, and the upright will follow it
Judgment will be delayed until the end of days
The wicked will receive righteous judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Judgment shall return to righteousness, and the upright will follow it
questions.explanation: The verse describes a restoration where judgment aligns with righteousness, followed by the upright in heart (Psalms 94:15).

questions.question: The plea in Psalms 94:16, 'Who will rise up for me against evildoers?', is an example of which literary form?
questions.correctAnswer: Imprecatory prayer
questions.explanation: The Psalmist calls for divine justice against evildoers, a hallmark of imprecatory prayers (Psalms 94:16).

questions.question: According to Psalms 94:18, what held the Psalmist up when his 'foot slipped'?
questions.correctAnswer: Thy mercy, O LORD
questions.explanation: The Psalmist attributes his support during adversity to the mercy of the LORD (Psalms 94:18).

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Psalms 94:20: 'Shall the throne of ______ have fellowship with thee, which frameth mischief by a law?'
questions.correctAnswer: iniquity
questions.explanation: The verse condemns the throne of iniquity which creates mischief under the guise of law (Psalms 94:20).

questions.question: Psalms 94:22 uses two metaphors for God as a protector. What are they?
questions.correctAnswer: Defence and rock of refuge
questions.explanation: The Psalmist describes the LORD as his defence and rock of refuge, symbolizing strength and safety (Psalms 94:22).

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 94:23 suggests that God will bring upon the wicked their own iniquity and cut them off.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states that God will repay the wicked according to their own wrongdoing and remove them (Psalms 94:23).

theological.title: Psalms Chapter 94 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Psalms Chapter 94 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Psalms 94, what is the nature of God in relation to judgment and vengeance?
options: God is the righteous judge who executes vengeance
God is indifferent to human wickedness
questions.correctAnswer: God is the righteous judge who executes vengeance
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:1-2 describe God as the one to whom vengeance belongs and who judges the earth, consistent with Deuteronomy 32:35, Romans 12:19, Hebrews 10:30, and Revelation 19:11 where God executes righteous judgment.

questions.question: What complaint does the psalmist make about the wicked in Psalms 94?
options: They triumph and boast of their evil deeds
They are oppressed by the righteous
questions.correctAnswer: They triumph and boast of their evil deeds
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:3-4 laments how long the wicked will triumph and boast, which aligns with themes in Habakkuk 1:4, Psalm 37:7, Ecclesiastes 8:11, and 1 Peter 3:12 regarding the temporary success of the wicked before God's judgment.

questions.question: Who are specifically mentioned as being oppressed by the wicked in Psalms 94?
questions.correctAnswer: Widows, strangers, and fatherless
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:6 highlights the wicked slaying the widow, stranger, and fatherless, reflecting God's concern for the vulnerable found also in Exodus 22:22-24, Deuteronomy 10:18, James 1:27, and Isaiah 1:17.

questions.question: What is the attitude of the wicked toward God's awareness of their actions, according to Psalms 94?
options: They say God does not see or regard their deeds
questions.correctAnswer: They say God does not see or regard their deeds
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:7 reports the wicked saying the LORD shall not see or regard their actions, a common skepticism countered in Proverbs 15:3, Psalm 139:7-12, Ecclesiastes 12:14, and Hebrews 4:13 which affirm God's omniscience.

questions.question: What rhetorical question does the psalmist use to affirm God's omniscience and omnipotence?
options: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?
How can God forget the wicked?
questions.correctAnswer: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:9 uses this rhetorical question to emphasize God's intimate knowledge and involvement, consistent with Job 12:10, Isaiah 40:26, Psalm 33:13-15, and Matthew 10:29-31 about God's sovereign care and awareness.

questions.question: How does Psalms 94 describe the thoughts of man in relation to God’s knowledge?
options: The LORD knows that they are vanity
Man’s thoughts are hidden from God
Man's thoughts are eternal and unchanging
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD knows that they are vanity
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:11 states God's knowledge of human thoughts as vanity, consistent with Psalm 39:5, Ecclesiastes 1:2, Isaiah 55:8-9, and Romans 8:6 which affirm human limitations and God's supreme wisdom.

questions.question: What blessing is pronounced on the man who is chastened and taught by the LORD in Psalms 94?
options: He is blessed and receives rest from adversity
He gains worldly wealth and honor
questions.correctAnswer: He is blessed and receives rest from adversity
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:12-13 bless the man whom God chastens and teaches, promising rest from adversity, a theme echoed in Proverbs 3:11-12, Hebrews 12:5-11, Romans 5:3-5, and James 1:2-4 concerning God's discipline producing blessing.

questions.question: What assurance does the psalmist give about God's relationship with His people in Psalms 94?
options: The LORD will not cast off His people nor forsake His inheritance
God abandons the wicked and the righteous alike
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD will not cast off His people nor forsake His inheritance
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:14 assures God's faithfulness to His people, consistent with Deuteronomy 31:6, Isaiah 41:10, Matthew 28:20, and Hebrews 13:5 which affirm God's steadfast presence with His covenant people.

questions.question: According to Psalms 94, what will judgment return to?
questions.correctAnswer: Righteousness
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:15 states that judgment shall return unto righteousness, aligning with Proverbs 21:15, Isaiah 61:8, Romans 2:5-11, and Revelation 20:12 where divine judgment is associated with justice and righteousness.

questions.question: Who does the psalmist ask to rise up against evildoers in Psalms 94?
options: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers?
Who will join the wicked in their deeds?
Who will commend the workers of iniquity?
questions.correctAnswer: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers?
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:16 expresses the psalmist's plea for vindication and support against evil, paralleling Exodus 14:14, Psalm 35:1, Isaiah 59:16, and Romans 8:31 where God is the defender of the righteous.

questions.question: What is the psalmist’s testimony about God’s help when he felt near silence and despair?
options: The LORD was my help and mercy held me up
God abandoned me in my distress
I relied on my own strength
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD was my help and mercy held me up
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:17-18 recount the psalmist’s experience of God's help and mercy preventing despair, consistent with Psalm 46:1, Isaiah 41:13, 2 Corinthians 12:9, and Hebrews 4:16 about God’s sustaining grace in trials.

questions.question: How does the psalmist describe the effect of many thoughts on his soul in Psalms 94?
options: My soul is overwhelmed without comfort
I find no peace in my mind
questions.correctAnswer: God’s comforts delight my soul
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:19 declares that despite many thoughts, God's comforts bring delight to the soul, echoed in Psalm 23:4, Isaiah 40:31, John 14:27, and Philippians 4:7 on divine peace amid anxiety.

questions.question: What does Psalms 94 say about the 'throne of iniquity' and its relationship with God?
options: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with God who frames mischief by a law?
The throne of iniquity is blessed by God
God supports the throne of iniquity
The throne of iniquity is beyond God's judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with God who frames mischief by a law?
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:20 questions any fellowship between God and a throne that creates mischief, consistent with Psalm 1:4-6, Proverbs 6:16-19, Isaiah 10:1-3, and Romans 1:18-32 where God's holiness is incompatible with wickedness.

questions.question: What does the psalmist affirm about the LORD in contrast to the wicked in Psalms 94?
options: The LORD is my defence and rock of refuge
The LORD sides with the wicked
The LORD is silent in injustice
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is my defence and rock of refuge
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:22 affirms God as the defender and refuge of the righteous, a theme found in Psalm 18:2, Nahum 1:7, 2 Samuel 22:3, and 1 Corinthians 10:4 highlighting God’s protection over His people.

questions.question: What final judgment does the psalmist declare about the wicked in Psalms 94?
options: The LORD will bring upon them their own iniquity and cut them off
The LORD will ignore their wickedness
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD will bring upon them their own iniquity and cut them off
questions.explanation: Psalms 94:23 promises that God will repay the wicked according to their deeds and remove them, consistent with Psalm 37:38, Proverbs 11:31, Isaiah 13:11, and Revelation 20:15 about divine retribution.
